Class MathX

  • java.lang.Object

        Returns:

      • randomInt

        public static int randomInt(int bound)
        Static wrapper method for Random's nextInt(int bound)
        Parameters:
        bound - The maximum (exclusive) value to be generated
        Returns:
        A random int between 0 and bound (exclusive)
        See Also:
        Random.nextInt(int bound)

      • randomInt

        public static int randomInt(int min,
                            int max)
        Based on Random's nextInt(int bound), generates an int between two bounds
        Parameters:
        min - Smallest number to generate (inclusive)
        max - Largest number to generate (inclusive)
        Returns:
        A random int between min and max inclusive

      • tween

        public static float tween(float value,
                          float target,
                          float factor)
        Logarithmically brings a value closer to a target by a specified percentage of distance.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to tween
        target - The value to tend towards
        factor - The percentage of distance to move
        Returns:
        The value tweened

      • tween

        public static double tween(double value,
                           double target,
                           double factor)
        Logarithmically brings a value closer to a target by a specified percentage of distance.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to tween
        target - The value to tend towards
        factor - The percentage of distance to move
        Returns:
        The value tweened

      • wrap

        public static byte wrap(byte value,
                        byte min,
                        byte max)
        Wraps a byte value around a min and max value, acting like a bidirectional modulus. When the value exceeds the min or max, it wraps to the opposite limit and continues in the same direction for the remainder, until the value falls between them (inclusively).
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be wrapped
        min - The minimum value
        max - The maximum value
        Returns:
        A byte value wrapped around a min and max until it falls between them

      • wrap

        public static double wrap(double value,
                          double min,
                          double max)
        Wraps a double value around a min and max value, acting like a bidirectional modulus. When the value exceeds the min or max, it wraps to the opposite limit and continues in the same direction for the remainder, until the value falls between them (inclusively).
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be wrapped
        min - The minimum value
        max - The maximum value
        Returns:
        A double value wrapped around a min and max until it falls between them

      • wrap

        public static float wrap(float value,
                         float min,
                         float max)
        Wraps a float value around a min and max value, acting like a bidirectional modulus. When the value exceeds the min or max, it wraps to the opposite limit and continues in the same direction for the remainder, until the value falls between them (inclusively).
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be wrapped
        min - The minimum value
        max - The maximum value
        Returns:
        A float value wrapped around a min and max until it falls between them
